title: NSW weather: severe rainfall and flooding on coast and heavy rain for Sydney â as it happened | Australia news | The Guardian
summary: emergency crews trying to reach 21 stranded campers .
severe weather in new south wales .
campers stranded by flood waters at deua national park .
more than 25 rescued in and around newcastle .

documents.title: after a wet and wild day â now for the clean-up
text: bom has cancelled its severe weather warning for act and nsw just before 5pm , as the low pressure system responsible for heavy rainfall and winds moves towards the northeast the 24 hours to 9am were the wettest january day bom has on record for the nobbys head station in newcastle , with 200.6 mm of rainfall ; it was also the wettest day of any month recorded since june 2007 most flooding occurred in rural areas , though at least 70 raymond terrace residents will remain outside their homes tonight after six streets were evacuated at least 21 campers will spend another night at the bendethera valley campground west of moruya , where they have been stranded since sunday but they are in touch with emergency services a search is underway for a yachtsman thrown off a yacht off the nsw mid-north coast , about 14km from port stephens dungog residents have returned to their homes after evacuation notices were issued on tuesday night nsw police and the emergency services minister david elliot are urging people to avoid driving through floodwaters rescue crews carried out 28 rescues from floodwaters across nsw , out of nearly 2000 calls for help since tuesday we 'll continue to monitor developments overnight and the clean-up tomorrow .

aap reports snow-like nsw streets : a coastal town on the mid-north coast looks like it 's getting to experience a belated white christmas after wild weather dumped a deluge of white sand across its streets .
the white sand , which is a few inches deep and has covered lawns on streets in winda woppa at hawks nest , has created a snow-like effect , holiday-maker colin burgess says .
he said the heavy rains and gale force winds that have prompted dozens of evacuations and flood rescues across the nsw hunter region had ruined many people 's holiday plans .
we 've been reduced to playing board games , drinking coffee and driving around to see what damage has been done , mr burgess told aap .
but we 're grateful we have n't been injured and there has n't been any major damage in the area , he said .
a search is underway for a man thrown off a yacht in rough seas off the nsw mid-north coast in wild weather .
the yachtsman was wiped off the vessel after being struck by a huge wave near broughton island , about 14km from port stephens , this afternoon .
a rescue helicopter has been dispatched to search for the man , aged in his 60s , as the yacht 's remaining crew made their way back to port stevens .
aap reports that the unrelenting rain has caused havoc across eastern nsw .
at least 21 campers are spending the night stranded at the bendethera valley campground west of moruya , where they have been since sunday .

the wet weather has prevented helicopter rescue crews from reaching the group of 16 adults and five children , who have enough food and water to last them at least two days ; national parks rangers are also with the group .
further north , at least 70 residents in raymond terrace will also spend the night away from home after they were ordered to evacuate with nearby hunter river expected to peak .
the small town of torryburn remains isolated by floodwaters which inundated a bridge , while 300 people have been isolated by minor flooding near colo , northwest of sydney .
dungog residents , meanwhile , have returned to their homes after evacuation notices were issued on tuesday night to about 10 streets in the hunter region town .
local woman jodie francey said people in the town were on tenterhooks because of the devastating floods which hit the town in april but conditions did n't seem as bad .
i think the amount of rain gave people a case of deja vu there are still people that are n't in their homes , ms francey told aap .
emergency services minister david elliot echoed the sentiment , saying the heavy rain was only 10 per cent of what was seen in the april storms .
mr elliot said he was delighted to learn that a person was issued with an infringement notice for negligent driving after driving through floodwaters .
it was only nine months ago that we saw a tragic loss of life in the april storms .
i would 've thought that the community concern and anxiety caused by those deaths would 've meant that we should n't have this problem , he said on wednesday .
he 's joined nsw police and the ses in their calls for people to avoid driving through floodwaters and only to travel if necessary .
across the state , rescue crews carried out 28 rescues from floodwaters while there have been nearly 2000 calls for help since tuesday .
most of these related to leaking roofs and property damage , but volunteers responded to everything from cows blocking traffic to airlifting a 42-weeks pregnant woman to hospital , the ses said .
it 's estimated a month 's rain has fallen in the past two days , with more than 200mm falling in less than 24 hours along parts of the mid-north coast .
more on that record-breaking rainfall in newcastle the 24 hours to 9am were the wettest january day bom has on record for the nobbys head station , with 200.6 mm of rainfall .
it is also the wettest day of any month recorded since june 2007 .
the station has records back to 1862 .

i 'm waiting for nsw state emergency services to return my call with an update from the raymond terrace , but as the cancellation of the severe weather warning goes to show , it seems like conditions are easing in accordance with bom 's forecast .
with rainfall slowing and river levels expected to peak in the next hour or two , the next priority will be clearing up after the floods and that work will take days , at least .
if water levels were n't enough to worry about , ses have warned of apparent attempts to raise donations by phone .
nsw ses ( @ nswses ) reports in the hunter of a telephone scammer seeking ses donations .
if you believe it 's a scam call crimestoppers on 1800 333 000 .

documents.title: severe weather warning cancelled
text: bom has just cancelled its severe weather warning in nsw and the act .
the immediate threat of severe weather has passed , but the situation will continue to be monitored and further warnings will be issued if necessary .
a low pressure system off the southern mid north coast continues to move towards the northeast , causing rainfall rates to ease in the mid north coast and hunter districts .

in the 24 hours to 9am this morning , 255 mm of rain fell at bungwahl near bulahdelah , including 80 mm in the hour to 7pm , 246 mm at lookout rd reservoir ( newcastle ) , 239 mm at upper chichester ( barringtom tops ) and 219 mm at williamtown .
spare a thought for the dog owners tonight .
ev lau ( @ getyourvoxoff ) hmm there does not seem to be a good time to walk the dog in this relentless sydney rain .
when will it stop ? !
jeffrey simpson ( @ doctorjeph ) dog wants walks .
i do n't think it will ever stop raining .
brian williams ( @ bjwilliam ) i 'm sure i heard my dog quack this morning .
though there are some who prefer wet weather to the other end of the sydney summer spectrum : jeffrey simpson ( @ doctorjeph ) dog walking in the rain < < < dog walking in 40 degree heat
abc 's dan cox is still on the scene in raymond terrace .
dan cox ( @ coxdan ) hunter st # raymondterrace has taken on water after # hunterriver broke its banks .
riverside park flooded .
# newyfloods dan cox ( @ coxdan ) # raymondterrace goes under again .
# newyfloods # hunterriver dan cox ( @ coxdan ) there are homes and cars taking on water in hunter & glenelg streets , # raymondterrace .
# newyfloods he 's spoken to the owner of the junction inn in raymond terrace , who seems to be more concerned by his dinner booking for 150 than flood waters .
dan cox ( @ coxdan ) # raymondterrace junction inn owner andrew : `` they 've evacuated us for some reason .
april was worse than this .
got 150 booked in for dinner . ''
dan cox ( @ coxdan ) # raymondterrace junction inn owner andrew assesses the # hunterriver : `` they 've told us all to get out . ''
# newyfloods then again , seen the hunter river flood once , seen it twenty times .
dan cox ( @ coxdan ) # raymondterrace junction inn owner andrew has been the publican for 33 yrs .
he 's seen the # hunterriver break its banks 20 times .
# newyfloods
now that the rain is starting to ease , the focus is shifting from rainfall to how that will impact river levels , with many not expected to peak for another couple of hours .
bom nsw regional hydrology manager gordon mckay says there has been major flooding of the patterson and williams rivers in the lower hunter region .

most of the flooding today has occurred in rural areas , though a few properties he estimated between eight to 12 , but deferred to ses for precise figures on low-lying areas of raymond terrace have been affected .
the still developing , but there 's been a moderate flood peak there .
though newcastle experienced record january rainfalls , it has been fairly even over the course of the day , which has helped to mitigate the risk , says mckay .
there were fairly intense periods but not as intense as that we saw in april last year , where we saw quite severe flooding in dungog and other places .
last april , most of a day 's [ ty rainfall fell in a few hours .
that intensity makes it much more problematic in terms of flooding .

though river levels expected to peak after 6pm , there are plenty of variables involved , says mckay , as the flooding in raymond terrace is affected by flows of the paterson and williams rivers , as well as the hunter .
we 're expecting those flows to arrive at around 6pm or 7pm , which will coincide with the rise in time .
you 're never sure exactly of the timing .
bom duty forecaster katarina kovacevic tells me the low-pressure system responsible for this severe weather is unfolding more or less exactly as laid out in this morning 's forecast .
when she arrived at work at 10.30am , rainfall in the affected hunter and mid-north coast regions had begun to ease , and it 's continued to do so .
more rain is expected this afternoon and this evening , as well as tomorrow but it seems the worst rainfall is well and truly behind us now , she says .

there is a chance that rain along the coastal fringe might continue for the next four to six hours , but past midnight and into tomorrow , rainfall will drop off fairly significantly as that low-pressure system travels offshore .
once that system moves away , the rain will move away it .
she says today 's events have been as per our expectation , despite these sorts of weather systems , known by bom as east coast lows , tending to be volatile and dynamic .

elle hunt ( @ mlle elle ) up-to-date flood warnings in nsw those red peaks reflecting major flooding are at paterson river at both gostwyck bridge ( 12.2m high ) and railway bridge ( 9.5m ) , and wollombi brook at bulga ( 4.7m ) .
the orange peak reflecting moderate flooding is the williams river at mill dam falls ( 8.7m ) .
bom last updated its flood warning for the hunter river just before 1pm , when it forecast minor to moderate flooding .
the lower hunter river at raymond terrace is forecast to peak near 3.3m around 6pm today with moderate flooding .
these from abc journalist dan cox reflect the situation there just after 3pm .
dan cox ( @ coxdan ) water is spilling onto the road from the # hunterriver at # raymondterrace .
# newyfloods dan cox ( @ coxdan ) no more wharf .
water is spilling onto the road from the # hunterriver at # raymondterrace .
# newyfloods the williams river at dungog is expected to peak soon , and at 7.5m below its high of 8.05m this morning .
there 's some flooding currently underway there , after this morning 's rainfall caused renewed river rises .
elle hunt ( @ mlle elle ) rainfall 2pm-3pm # sydneyrain
thanks michael .

documents.title: emergency crews trying to reach 21 stranded campers
text: emergency crews are trying to reach a group of at least 21 campers who have become trapped by flood waters in southern nsw , aap is reporting .
bendethera valley campground west of moruya has been isolated by heavy rains and flooding with at least 16 adults and five children trapped at the site , an ses spokesman said .
there has been no direct contact since sunday they have been isolated since then , he said .
the campsite is extremely isolated and without mobile phone reception , making it hard for crews to understand the conditions in the site but it 's likely they will be running low on food he said .
search crews could n't reach the campground on tuesday and difficult weather was causing problems for the westpac rescue helicopter to land in the area .
kathie bowtell in largs , also north of maitland , has posted this video of the overflowing hunter river .
kathie bowtell ( @ kathiebowtell ) @ 1233newcastle @ twitterid46 hunter river at # largs now breached the upper bank but levy holding the banks of wallis lake , south of forster .
emma simkin ( @ simkinemma ) wallis lake wet and windy @ 1233newcastle # nswweather more from emma simkin , an abc journalist based in the region .

emma simkin ( @ simkinemma ) branch has taken down power line on lakes way near boomerang beach # nswweather @ 1233newcastle emma simkin ( @ simkinemma ) tree down on coomba rd in coomba park , mid north coast # nswweather @ 1233newcastle
a dam breaks in duns creek , north of maitland : lynns ( @ bluemeeper ) @ 1233newcastle paddock near duns creek .
dam off to the right has now overflowed and turned into a torrent of water .
my colleague nick evershed has created this handy visualisation to give you a sense of what 's happening in nsw this week and how it compares to deluges past .
composite of rain visualisation images composite : nick evershed/guardian australia check it out here

documents.title: more than 25 rescued in and around newcastle
text: more than 25 people have been rescued and properties have been evacuated near newcastle as downpours continue across nsw , aap is reporting .
here 's more : around 30 properties were evacuated in raymond terrace as floodwaters rise and ses warned people to avoid the area unless absolutely necessary .
residents returned to homes in dungog after evacuation notices were issued on tuesday night to about 10 streets in the town in hunter region of nsw .
jodie francey told aap that people in the town were on tenterhooks because of the devastating floods in april but conditions did n't seem to be as bad .
i think the amount of rain gave people a case of deja vu there are still people that are n't in their homes , ms francey , who has lived in dungog for six years , told aap .
ses spokeswoman jacqueline rose said that the situation in the town was under control but they were still monitoring river levels .
a town of around 400 people remain isolated in nearby torryburn after flood waters inundated a bridge .
ses have received around 1796 calls since tuesday and responded to everything from cows blocking traffic to air lifting a 42 week pregnant woman to hospital , ms rose said .
major flooding also continues to grow in wollombi brook but no properties have yet been affected .
we ca n't leave at moment but really we are quite safe , wollombi brook cottage owner melina adams told aap .
a severe weather warning remains in place for dangerous flash flooding and possible gale-force winds for areas of new south wales .
more than 200mm of rain has fallen in less than 24 hours in parts of the mid-north coast , with the hunter valley region among the worst-affected areas .
evacuation orders have been issued for six streets in raymond terrace , where emergency services have been working to rescue people trapped in their cars by flood waters .
some streets in dungog have also been evacuated .
motorists are being urged to exercise caution on the roads and avoid some altogether , with 21 people having had to be rescued from their cars since the storm began .
newcastle has seen its wettest three-day rainfall total for january ( 273 mm ) and its wettest january day ( 201 mm ) .
its airport reopened its runway at noon after flooding forced its closure earlier today .
a group of approximately 21 campers are cut off by flood waters at deua national park , and are unable to be reached by emergency services by land or air .
a search is underway for man who disappeared into massive seas after falling overboard from yacht off coast of port stephens .
day four of the third test between australia and west indies at the sydney cricket ground has been washed out due to rain ; entry will be free of charge on day five .
nsw transport minister andrew constance will update on wet weather disruptions at the eveleigh transport management centre at 2pm .
flooding levels are expected to peak mid-afternoon , and the conditions are still expected to ease by evening .
bom will issue its next warning before 6pm .
abc grandstand ( @ abcgrandstand ) play abandoned at the scg .
# ausvwi surprise , surprise day four of the third test has been washed out without a ball being bowled , reports aap .
near-constant showers hit sydney on tuesday , when the covers stayed in place throughout the day and no play was possible .
there was more of the same heavy rain on wednesday , with officials giving up hope of any play shortly before 1pm aedt .
day two of the test between australia and west indies was also ruined because of rain , with only 11.2 overs of play possible .
the bureau of meteorology is predicting showers will ease on day five .
west indies are 7-248 in the first innings of the match , with nathan lyon and james pattinson both having snared two wickets .
allrounder mitch marsh , speaking after day three was abandoned , was n't ready to concede the match would end in a draw .
a result is up to the weather gods .
if we can get a full day 's play tomorrow and the last day , we will certainly be playing for a result , marsh said .
entry to day five will be free of charge , abc grandstand reports .
abc grandstand ( @ abcgrandstand ) cricket australia have thrown the gates open for the fifth and final day .
# ausvwi
evacuations are ongoing in raymond terrace .
kate haberfield ( @ katehaberfield ) ses about to start evacuating residents in low lying areas in rymd terrace .
evac order issues for 6 streets @ twitterid kate haberfield ( @ katehaberfield ) rain bucketing down as hunter river steadily rises in raymond terrace .
@ twitterid nick moir ( @ nampix ) resident evacuate homes in # raymondterrace # flooding paul kadak ( @ paulkadak ) evacuations underway at # raymondterrace as streets go under .
# flood and # rain latest on @ 7newssydney .
# weather marina neil ( @ marinasmarina ) # flooding in # raymondterrace port stephens st , emergency services evacuation homes .
@ twitterid marina neil ( @ marinasmarina ) kellie dahl wades through flood water at # raymondterrace # flood @ twitterid
service nsw has announced that some services have been impacted in the hunter and central coast regions due to the extreme weather .
maitland , gosford and newcastle service centres are closing at 5pm and wallsend is now staying open until 7pm .
driver testing has been postponed at some locations and impacted customers are being contacted to reschedule .
service nsw ( @ servicensw ) @ servicensw maitland , gosford & newcastle service centres are closing at 5pm today .

wallsend is staying open until 7pm , rain eased off nsw transport minister andrew constance , roads minister duncan gay and emergency services minister david elliott will hold a brief update on wet weather disruptions at the eveleigh transport management centre at 2pm .

in the 24 hours to 9am today 255mm of rain fell in bungwahl , near bulahdelah 239mm in upper chichester , near barrington tops 230mm in wallsend 228mm in macquarie college 225mm in merewether 223mm in williamtown airport 201mm in nobbys head 188mm in dungog 129mm in frenchs forest bom new south wales ( @ bom nsw ) 108mm rain and counting during the syd test # ausvwi .
nowhere near aus vs pak 3-8 feb 1990 ( 476mm over duration ) .
my colleague nick evershed has updated his nifty visualisation to put the rainfall into context .
compare it to queensland 's 2011 cyclone yasi ; the dungog storm of april 2015 ; melbourne drizzle ; or a weather event of your devising .
from drizzle to downpours : how nsw severe weather compares read more
the minister for emergency services , david elliott , has urged motorists to avoid flood waters .
elliott said since the beginning of the storm , the nsw ses had conducted 21 flood rescues , most of which were completely unnecessary .
despite countless warnings , people are continuing to risk their lives and the lives of volunteers by crossing floodwaters , elliott said .
floods can be extremely dangerous , it is critical to remain vigilant and aware of the changing conditions .
the best way you can help emergency service workers is to stay on high ground .
anyone who chooses to ignore the warnings and drive through flooded roads could face a fine in excess of $ 400 for negligent driving .

bom has reiterated that a severe weather warning remains in place for parts of the mid-north coast and hunter regions and that it 's expected to ease this evening ð acting nsw regional director , stephen lellyett , said the slow-moving low pressure system near port stephens was causing both riverine and flash flooding , with more than 250mm rainfall near bulahdelah .

the risk of localised , very heavy rainfall and dangerous flash-flooding remained in the newcastle , gosford , maitland , nelson bay , raymond terrace , wallsend , toronto , morisset , wyong , the entrance , taree and dungog areas .
lellyett cautioned against surfing in this weather , with damaging winds and dangerous conditions along the coast .
the lower hunter valley , lake macquarie and tuggerah lake remain on flood watch , while a number of warnings have been issued .
sydney is on the fringe of the weather system , though rain will ease in the afternoon and evening .
josie byrne in wallsend says although the rain has eased slightly there , it shows no signs of letting up entirely .
the canals are completely raging and have overflowed .
there are shops closed and roads were closed through the night , but they are now open again .
the coles supermarket in wallsend is open but there are large amounts of debris in the carpark from flooding overnight .
she says there are significant areas inundated , including federal park .
on the bright side , she says the ducks having a pretty good time enjoying the puddles .

documents.title: evacuations ordered in raymond terrace
text: paul kadak ( @ paulkadak ) # flood evacuations just ordered in # raymondterrace as hunter river rises .
30 properties impacted .

@ 7newssydney state emergency services have ordered the evacuation of six streets in raymond terrace , with residents of hunter st , glenelg st , swan st , port stephens st , king st and kangaroo st told to leave their homes immediately .
flooding of the hunter river is now expected to be moderate to major .
nsw incident alerts ( @ nswincidents ) # raymondterrace : expected to reach 3.3m later this afternoon with moderate flooding .
an evacuation centre has been set up at the seniors citizens centre at boomerang park , located at the corner of william and irrawang streets .
the centre is being manned by community services , anglicare and the salvation army crews , and can offer temporary accommodation , financial help , personal support , meals and clothing .
it has not yet received any evacuees .
the port stephens examiner reports that it 's the second time in nine months residents have braced for storm and flood damage , following the april 21 super storm .

everything 's on high ground . ''

it was floating on the trailer because it was waist deep in the backyard . ''

in sydney , the conditions are inconvenient , rather than dangerous so what 's social media good for , if not complaining about the weather ?

documents.title: campers stranded by flood waters at deua national park
text: approximately 21 people are isolated by flood waters at the bendethera camping area of the deua national park , 320km south of sydney .

in an update to facebook posted just after 11am , ashley sullivan , an incident controller with the illawarra south coast region , said the nsw ses was notified of their situation by family members on tuesday , but attempts to reach them had so far been unsuccessful .
we have ad hoc contact with the campers through local farmers , however no direct contact can be made .
ses personnel have tried to reach them over land from moruya and braidwood , and several times by air by the westpac life saver rescue helicopter .
sullivan told canberra times reporter katie burgess that the group of campers might have exhausted essential supplies , as they were supposed to return several days ago .
there is no phone reception out there and they could be running out of food or have run into a medical emergency .

the ses would continue to attempt to access the camping area and to check on the isolated campers ' welfare with assistance from national park rangers and special operations paramedics from nsw ambulance .
back in inner-city sydney , wet weather can bring out the best in people .
erin riley ( @ erinrileyau ) a man ran down the street to give me his large , very nice umbrella as i was walking home in heavy rain .

faith in humanity restored sbs news journalist sylvia varnham o'regan wrote about a similar experience on facebook ( feeling grateful ) : faith restored in humanity just now when i was walking along the street getting absolutely destroyed by rain and a man pulled up next to me and handed me an umbrella out the window .
legend !
remember to observe proper etiquette while wielding your wet weather gear out in the city today .

bronwen thompson ( @ bondigal ) got ta love it on public transport when folks think it 's ok to put their wet umbrella on the seat # sheesh # sydney ï¸ï¸ï¸ shaun h ( @ shaun hardy ) me : ducks your umbrella pointed at my eyes you : derp ! !
this is sydney every time it rains meghna bali ( @ meghnabali ) people who text/watch vids while walking in the rain with an umbrella on a crowded street , darwinism is coming for you .
plus the culprit 's come clean .
rick morton ( @ squigglyrick ) a couple of weeks ago i bought an expensive umbrella and then silently whinged i did n't get to use it .
so my apologies .
the maritime rescue boat that was sinking in the newcastle suburb of carrington has been righted by a crane .
georginasmythnbn ( @ georgiesmyth ) even marine rescue boats are n't coping with heavy rain .
this one sinking in newcastle .

newcastle airport ( @ ntlairport ) update 11am : the runway at newcastle airport will be reopened at midday today .
please check with you airline re the status of your flight .

she 's also tweeted of some pretty striking scenes of flood waters in cooks hill , an inner-city suburb of newcastle .

not as much water as last april thankfully !
@ twitterid

my colleague helen davidson has filed this from darwin : in the north of the country , flood waters are beginning to slowly recede at daly river , but its 500 residents will remain at the makeshift evacuation centre at darwin showgrounds .
the flood peaked at the major level of 14.7m , inundating the northern territory community , also know as nauiyu , over christmas .
residents were evacuated by helicopter and bus .
pets were also airlifted out some days later , after reports crocodiles had come into town with the flood waters and taken at least two dogs .
the nt chief minister , adam giles , visited the community on tuesday and said he anticipated people would be able to start returning next week , the abc reported .
however nt emergency services warned they would need to monitor the river before confirming a fixed return date .
acting nsw premier troy grant has reminded motorists to steer clear of flood waters .
troy grant ( @ troygrant ) my thoughts are with all residents and evacuees in coastal nsw right now .
stay safe in this wild weather and do n't drive in flood waters .
abc news journalist jackson vernon tweeted this image of flooded roads in newcastle .
jackson vernon ( @ jacksonvernon ) flooded roads like this can b seen all around newcastle .

this 1 in the raymond terrace area @ twitterid @ 1233newcastle an evacuation warning was issued for the raymond terrace area above by the port stephens unit of nsw ses about an hour ago , reporting that flood water from the hunter river had started to inundate lower parts of the cbd .

kate haberfield ( @ katehaberfield ) police & rfs working out a plan of attack in evacuation warning area in raymond terrace @ twitterid at that time flooding in the area was expected to be moderate to major , though the actual height remained unpredictable .
residents were encouraged to maintain a vigilant watch on the situation and to prepare to evacuate by ses : raise belongings by placing them on tables , beds and benches .
put electrical items on top .

you may be able to place lightweight items in the roof space collect together medicines , personal and financial documents , mementos and photos if possible , check to see whether your neighbours need help make arrangements for care of pets or other animals , you may take your pets with if you when you evacuate if you have to evacuate : turn off the electricity and water take three days ' supply of clothes , medicines , documents , mementos and photos with you continue to listen to a local radio station for updates an evacuation centre is going to be established at the senior citizens centre at boomerang park .

kate haberfield ( @ katehaberfield ) evac warning 4 hunter st , glenelg st , swan st , port stephens st , king st & kangaroo st in raymond terrace @ twitterid kate haberfield ( @ katehaberfield ) flood water inundating several homes in raymond terrace @ twitterid kate haberfield ( @ katehaberfield ) not ideal when you 're trying to sell your house !
this near tomago @ twitterid

documents.title: bom updates severe weather warning
text: bom has issued a new severe weather warning for the hunt and mid-north coast regions of nsw .
it forecasts ongoing heavy rain and flash-flooding for eastern parts of the hunter region , extending to southern parts of the mid-north coast .
some locations between gosford and port macquarie can expect further total rainfalls of 50mm to 100mm today .
elle hunt ( @ mlle elle ) as you can see from bom 's 11am update , the affected area is quite specific # sydneyrain bom will issue its next warning before 6pm .
the good news the forecast still indicates the weather will have eased by evening .
bogging : yet another reason why , if you can help it , you ought to stay off roads around the nsw central and mid-north coasts today .
police say four tourists were rescued on tuesday from a bush track in the olney state forest on the central coast after their vehicle became stuck in mud .

here 's more : the men , believed to be from germany , contacted triple zero ( 000 ) about 4.30pm yesterday ( tuesday 5 january 2016 ) , after they realised their 4wd was irretrievably stuck in mud in the olney state forest , following heavy rain in the area .
members of the central coast volunteer rescue association ( vra ) began searching for the men and , about 11pm , found the group on a track known as lemon tree road .
the men were taken to wyong police station where police verified they were not injured or requiring medical attention .
police from tuggerah lakes local area command are urging drivers to take care during the current wet conditions , especially when travelling off-road .
meanwhile , with the wet weather forecast to continue , police are reminding the community never to drive , ride or walk through floodwaters .
it is extremely dangerous as fast-moving undercurrents can quickly wash people and vehicles away .
it 's a record , according to the bom .
the last three days newcastle has seen its highest recorded january rainfalls ever and its wettest january day , though the tweet does n't say which day exactly that was .
bom new south wales ( @ bom nsw ) in the 72 hours to 9am wed , newcastle recorded its wettest 3-day rainfall total for jan ( 273mm ) and wettest jan day ( 201 mm ) .

documents.title: newcastle airport runway closed
text: nothing is landing at or leaving newcastle airport for the time being flood waters on the runway mean air traffic has ground to a halt .
nbn news ( @ nbnnews ) # newcastle airport terminal open but no flights in or out at the moment .
runway flooded .
via @ twitterid emergency services have also issued these predictions for flood waters across towns in the hunter raymond terrace the worst hit .

abc emergency ( @ abcemergency ) # nsw predicted heights : bulga 5.1m , maitland-belmore bridge 7m with minor flooding ; raymond terrace 3.3m with moderate flooding as we reported earlier , residents of hunter st , glenelg st , swan st , port stephens st , king st & kangaroo st in raymond 's terrace have been advised to evacuate .
here 's a friendly warning from the nsw police about not driving through flood water under any circumstances .
a gentleman in seymour , victoria sadly lost his life trying to cross a flooded bridge on monday .
police would like to remind the community to never drive , ride or walk through flood waters .
it is extremely dangerous as fast-moving undercurrents can quickly wash people and vehicles away .
if you must drive , please follow these simple tips to help keep you safe on the road : 1.turn your headlights on .
not only will your lights help you see the road , but they 'll help other drivers see you .
slow down .
it seems obvious , but it 's always a good idea in wet weather to ease up on the gas.you should also increase the distance between you and the cars ahead .
patience .
the most important thing is to be patient .
when it 's raining and chaotic , everyone 's in the same boat .
keep in mind , too : driving through high waters is considered negligent driving and attracts a $ 425 fine .

abc emergency ( @ abcemergency ) # nsw evacuation warning issued by @ twitterid for raymond terrace - hunter st , glenelg st , swan st , port stephens st , king st & kangaroo st if you live in any of these streets in raymond terrace , it 's time to evacuate .

abc emergency ( @ abcemergency ) # nsw minor flood warning for upper wyong river and tuggerah lake anyone living around the upper wyong river and tuggerah lake also needs to be cautious a minor flood warning has been issued for both .
briefly taking over weatherman duties here tweet at me with your rain-based content at @ twitterid , or let me know what 's happening in the comments below .
the hunter valley is one of the country 's premier wine regions , and summer is harvest time .
what does the last week 's inclement weather mean for this year 's drop ?
nothing good , says mark from mcwilliams mount pleasant winery , which specialises in pinot noirs .
rain is never good at this time of year .
the hailstorms can introduce mould , the grapes do n't ripen the same way that you want , he said .
i really want some dry weather now .
he likened the impact of the wet weather to water in concentrated cordial .
the less water you put in , the stronger the flavour .
the more water you put in the weaker the flavour , he said .
with this rain you wo n't get that rich sugar content at the levels you 'd prefer .
luckily , the hunter river is about 30km from wine country , so if it breaks its banks , tours part of the economic lifeblood of the region will go on .

bom 's rainfall and river conditions interactive , able to be toggled by rainfalls since 9am , in the past hour and over 24 hours , provides an at-a-glance view of the weather battering the nsw coast .
elle hunt ( @ mlle elle ) rainfall in 24hrs to 9am wednesday .
the red dots = 100mm+ ; orange 50-99mm ; green 25-49mm i 'm handing over coverage to my colleague michael safi for the next half-hour as i venture outside to experience the conditions first-hand .
ausgrid has reminded residents of the hunter and central coast regions to be prepared for power cuts in the heavy rain and wind .
you can keep up with updates on ausgrid 's website .
ausgrid ( @ ausgrid ) heavy rain & winds forecast for hunter & central coast .
if power goes out check 4 details at

documents.title: 2015 australia 's fifth-warmest year on record
text: today 's severe weather coincides with the release of bom 's annual climate statement for 2015 australia 's fifth-warmest year on record , with national rainfall slightly below average .
bom 's key findings are below , but you can read more here .

2015 was another warm year , especially during the last three months strong el niã±o , comparable to the el niã±o events of 199798 and 198283 overall , it was australia 's fifth-warmest year on record with the annual national mean temperature 0.83 â°c above average warmest october on record nationally , for both maxima and minima , with the largest mean temperature anomaly on record for any month western australia , queensland , victoria , south australia , and new south wales ranked in the ten warmest years on record nationally-averaged rainfall 5 % below average for the year , at 443.7 mm ( 19611990 average 465.2 mm ) rainfall below average for parts of the top end , most of queensland , victoria , tasmania , southeast and western south australia , and southwest western australia rainfall above average for the gascoyne and pilbara in western australia , most of the central northern territory , northeastern south australia , and northwestern new south wales
commercial weather website weatherzone reports that heavy rain has reached record levels in newcastle , one of the regions most affected by the low-pressure system .
weatherzone ( @ weatherzone ) hunter flood threat increasing as newcastle area receives heaviest rain in 25 years , about 300mm roads remain closed and warnings are in place for the region .
georginasmythnbn ( @ georgiesmyth ) even marine rescue boats are n't coping with heavy rain .
this one sinking in newcastle .
@ twitterid the below screenshot was posted at 6am .
gavin morris ( @ gavinmorrisnbn ) low has stalled and sitting off newcastle coast rain to continue this morning over suburbs .
200+ wallsend @ twitterid .
not everyone is unhappy with the wet conditions .
happy paws ( @ happypawsncl ) at least lacey is enjoying the torrential rain anyway !
# dogs # newcastle
rain has been falling fairly consistently in sydney since sunday , though bom seems to be continuing to forecast a 90 % chance of rainfall .
it 's expected to ease to showers by the evening .
the southerly wind is new today and reaching speeds of between 25 and 40 km/h .

kirsten grosman ( @ groskirst ) does n't look much like summer in # sydney with all this rain ð¨ð¨ð¨±±± and in the bom image below , you can see that slow-moving low pressure system over the mid-north coast and hunter districts .
it 's forecast to move to the north-east later on today and tonight , and the weather will ease with it .
nsw police ( @ nswpolice ) rain expected for much of # nsw today .
if you 're on the road , please slow down and never drive through flood waters .
though the severe weather warnings are restricted to new south wales , bom has issued major flood warnings for the flinders , norman and bulloo rivers in queensland .
moderate warnings also apply to the barcoo river and cooper creek ; georgina river and eyre creek ; and the paroo river .
aap reports that wet conditions are prolonging the recovery of a derailed train that spilled more than 30,000 litres of sulfuric acid in queensland 's northwest .
queensland rail says its crews are working hard to restore services on the train line , with plans to build a temporary track around the crash site .
the mount isa line remains closed , with the locomotive and 26 wagons still on their side .
flash flooding in nsw has resulted in 21 rescues in two days as drivers continue to ignore warnings from emergency services , reports aap .
state emergency services say nine people were rescued on tuesday night ; most had got stuck driving through flood waters that were deeper than they first appeared .

more than 200mm of rain has fallen in less than 24 hours along parts of the mid-north coast , with a severe weather warning in place for dangerous flash flooding and possible gale-force winds from gosford to port macquarie .
some streets in dungog have been evacuated while sandbagging efforts are under way .
parts of the pacific highway have been closed while motorists are urged to use extreme caution on parts that remain open .
the ses had been 1,400 requests for assistance overnight with newcastle , dungog and maitland among the areas hardest hit , spokeswoman jacqueline rose said .
bureau of meteorology forecaster dmitriy danchuk described the rain as quite exceptional .
the heaviest falls include 255mm recorded in less than 24 hours near forster .
on quite a few occasions around newcastle we 've up more than 200mm of rain since 9am tuesday , he told aap .
the rain is still continuing .
the ses has again warned people to stay out of flood water .

documents.title: severe weather in new south wales
text: welcome to our liveblog of the severe weather battering parts of nsw .
roads have turned to rivers across coastal parts of the state , forcing the rescue of dozens of motorists since tuesday , while areas of the pacific highway remain closed .
several rivers are on the brink of flooding following heavy rainfall .
the gloucester river peaked near 4.3m at 2am .
the bureau of meteorology has issued severe weather warnings for damaging winds and heavy rainfall that could lead to dangerous flash floods in parts of nsw .

localised heavy rainfall , and associated flash-flooding , and damaging winds averaging 60 to 65 km/h are forecast for parts of the mid north coast and hunter districts ( including the central coast ) today .
between 9am tuesday and 7am this morning , 254mm of rain fell at bungwahl , near bulahdelah including 80mm in the hour to 70pm .
the weather is caused by a slow-moving low pressure system near port stephens , forecast to move to the northeast this afternoon .
at this stage , it 's expected to ease later today , but in the meantime , we suggest keeping inside as we keep you up to date with the latest from bom .
you can comment below with your own experience of the severe weather , or tweet at me at @ twitterid elle .

bulletin.text: Severe weather warnings for damaging winds and heavy rainfall in the Hunter and mid-north coast.
Flash floods force dozens of rescues in two days.
Newcastle had highest recorded January rainfalls and its wettest January day.
